subtopics.title: Introduction to Polynomials
subtopics.content:
Introduction

Polynomials are algebraic expressions formed by variables, coefficients, and powers of variables. They are fundamental in algebra and are used to solve equations and model real-life problems.

subtopics.title: Definition of a Polynomial
subtopics.content:
Definition

An expression of the form:

p(x) = aₙxⁿ + aₙ₋₁xⁿ⁻¹ + … + a₁x + a₀

where coefficients aₙ, aₙ₋₁, …, a₀ are real numbers and n is a non-negative integer.

subtopics.title: Types of Polynomials (Based on Terms)
subtopics.content:
Types Based on Terms

  • Monomial: one term (e.g., 7x)
  • Binomial: two terms (e.g., x² + 5)
  • Trinomial: three terms (e.g., x² + 3x + 2)

subtopics.title: Degree of a Polynomial
subtopics.content:
Degree of a Polynomial

The highest power of the variable in the polynomial.

Example: In 4x⁵ – 3x² + x, the degree is 5.

subtopics.title: Types of Polynomials (Based on Degree)
subtopics.content:
Types Based on Degree

  • Constant polynomial: degree 0 (e.g., 7)
  • Linear: degree 1 (e.g., 3x + 2)
  • Quadratic: degree 2 (e.g., x² – 4x + 4)
  • Cubic: degree 3 (e.g., x³ + x² + 1)

subtopics.title: Zeros of a Polynomial
subtopics.content:
Zeros of a Polynomial

A number k is a zero of p(x) if p(k) = 0.

Example: For p(x) = x² – 4, zeros are ±2.

subtopics.title: Remainder Theorem
subtopics.content:
Remainder Theorem

If a polynomial p(x) is divided by (x – a), the remainder is p(a).

subtopics.title: Factor Theorem
subtopics.content:
Factor Theorem

If p(a) = 0, then (x – a) is a factor of p(x).

Example: For p(x) = x² – 5x + 6, p(2)=0, so (x–2) is a factor.

questions.question: Which of the following is a polynomial?
questions.explanation: 3x³ – 7x + 2 is a polynomial because it has no negative powers or division by variable. x² + 1/x and 5/x have variables in the denominator, which is not allowed.

questions.question: The degree of 2x⁴ + 7x² – 3 is:
questions.explanation: The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of the variable. Here, the highest power is 4.

questions.question: The number of terms in x³ + 2x² – 5x + 7 is:
questions.explanation: The polynomial x³ + 2x² – 5x + 7 has four terms: x³, 2x², -5x, and 7.

questions.question: Which of the following is a cubic polynomial?
questions.explanation: A cubic polynomial has degree 3. x³ – 7 has the highest power of 3, making it cubic.

questions.question: If p(x) = x² – 4, then one of its zeros is:
questions.explanation: A zero of p(x) is a value that makes p(x) = 0. p(2) = 2² – 4 = 4 – 4 = 0, so 2 is a zero.

questions.question: Which theorem states that if p(a)=0, then (x–a) is a factor?
questions.explanation: The Factor Theorem states that if p(a) = 0, then (x – a) is a factor of p(x).

questions.question: What is the remainder when p(x) = x² – 3x + 2 is divided by (x–1)?
questions.explanation: By the Remainder Theorem, the remainder when p(x) is divided by (x–1) is p(1). p(1) = 1² – 3(1) + 2 = 1 – 3 + 2 = 0.

questions.question: A polynomial of degree 1 is called:
questions.explanation: A polynomial of degree 1 is called a linear polynomial. Example: 3x + 2.

questions.question: The zero of polynomial p(x) = x + 7 is:
questions.explanation: The zero is the value that makes p(x) = 0. Setting x + 7 = 0 gives x = –7.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a polynomial?
questions.explanation: x⁻¹ + 4 is not a polynomial because it contains a negative exponent (x⁻¹ = 1/x), which is not allowed in polynomials.
